smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class OrderFilter defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class RequestPasswordReset defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class CheckEmailResponse defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class EmailVerificationResponse defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class PasswordReset defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class ResetPasswordResponse defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class Paypal defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class Tax defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `event to order`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `event to it`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `editText to layout`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `searchAndLocation[0] to searchAndLocation[1]`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `query to location`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `e to RC_CREDENTIALS_READ`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `e to RC_CREDENTIALS_SAVE`

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message:
Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
        childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
        childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Ticket::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
        childColumns = ["ticket"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Ticket::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
        childColumns = ["ticket"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)
Parentheses in (safeArgs.speakerId == -1L) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: safeArgs.speakerId == -1L

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.CAMERA) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.CAMERA) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED
Parentheses in (safeArgs.sessionId == -1L) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: safeArgs.sessionId == -1L

Parentheses around the lambda ({ user ->
                mutableUser.value = user
                loadMySpeaker(user, eventId, eventIdentifier)
            }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses around the lambda ({
                mutableMessage.value = resource.getString(R.string.image_upload_success_message)
                encodedImage = null
                val newSpeaker = speaker.copy(photoUrl = it.url)
                editSpeaker(newSpeaker)
                Timber.d("Image uploaded ${it.url}")
            }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.CAMERA) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(requireContext(),
            Manifest.permission.CAMERA) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses around the lambda ({ user ->
                Timber.d("Response Success")
                this.mutableUser.value = user
            }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses around the lambda ({ user ->
                Timber.d("Response Success")
                this.mutableUpdatedUser.value = user
            }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (itemCount == 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: itemCount == 0

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = CASCADE)
Parentheses in (ticketPrice * tax.rate / 100) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ticketPrice * tax.rate / 100
Parentheses in (ticket.price * tax.rate) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ticket.price * tax.rate
Parentheses in (ticket.price * 100) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ticket.price * 100
Parentheses in (ticketPrice * discountCode.value / 100) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ticketPrice * discountCode.value / 100

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = CASCADE)
Parentheses in (ticket.price * taxRate / 100) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ticket.price * taxRate / 100

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)

Parentheses in (ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ForeignKey(entity = Event::class, parentColumns = ["id"],
    childColumns = ["event"], onDelete = ForeignKey.CASCADE)

smells.name: SerialVersionUIDInSerializableClass
smells.description: A class which implements the Serializable interface does not define a correct serialVersionUID field. The serialVersionUID field should be a constant long value inside a companion object.

instances.message: The class TicketIdAndQtyWrapper implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.

smells.name: ForbiddenVoid
smells.description: `Unit` should be used instead of `Void`.

instances.message: 'Void' should be replaced with 'Unit'.
